reasoning: MEN2a is a rare autosomal dominant genetic disorder. Prevalence estimated at 1-2 per 100k based on RET mutation screening and family studies. Incidence not well-defined due to diagnosis primarily through genetic screening of at-risk families rather than population surveillance. Using prevalence as the appropriate metric for a lifelong genetic condition.
source: Brandi ML et al. (2001). Guidelines for diagnosis and therapy of MEN type 1 and type 2. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 86(12):5658-5671
